title: Adjust Home hero spacing to lower primary CTA buttons

requirements.summary: Lower the HomePage hero CTA button row by increasing vertical spacing above it while preserving all existing hero content, overlays, responsiveness, and navigation behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Home page hero, the “Open AI App Builder” and “Browse Opportunities” buttons render noticeably lower than before (increased vertical spacing above the button row) on mobile and desktop breakpoints.
The hero’s supporting paragraph and “AI-Powered App Builder” label remain in the same order and remain readable against the background image due to the existing overlay gradients.
No changes to button text (must remain in English) and both buttons still navigate correctly to /builder and /browse.
No changes are made to the global sticky header navigation (frontend/src/components/AppShell.tsx) as part of this spacing adjustment.

file_operations.description: Adjust the hero layout spacing by increasing the top padding/margin applied to the CTA button-row container (currently the wrapper div with `flex flex-wrap ... pt-6`) using responsive Tailwind classes (e.g., larger `pt-*` with an `md:` variant) so the button row sits further down within the hero on both mobile and desktop, without changing any hero text, overlay gradient elements, or the existing navigate targets (/builder, /browse).
